snippet: New York City’s most troubled students are falling into the cracks created by the Education Department’s tough policies.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column questions Bloomberg administration's strategy of closing large schools that are described as failing and replacing them with smaller schools and charters; says despite administration's claims of success, approach has the effect of channeling most troubled students to the most troubled schools and is ultimately failing black and Latino students.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s most troubled students are falling into the cracks created by the Education Department’s tough policies.
